column165: "Software practices" is a bit fuzzy, but I work for an open-core tech company on one of our open source projects so...open source has a huge impact here! One specific example is that we recently contributed a config option `StrictHostKeyChecking` to be read from the ssh config file for `net-ssh`, the ruby library for SSHing into things programmatically.
column166: Another example is, because our project is open source, we regularly get contributions for new features, bug fixes, docs updates, and more from our users. For example an external user laid the groundwork for us to add Kerberos support to our project.
